CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Jim-Crow in North, Also - Not all discrimination is in South. And Fifth Ward Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald (left photo, wearing glasses) said during the past week that he had two of its local perpetrators.  He declared that Mrs. Mary Dudiak (left photo, center) and John Martinez, (right photo, extreme right) are typical of the tavern owners who are maintaining jim-crow here, especially in the small towns of Allegheny County.  Mrs. Dudiak, standing beside her son, Chester, was charged with refusing service to (left photo, left to right), Robert Abraham and John Duffy, and Martis Manley (not shown) when they entered her Breckenridge tavern on Sept. 19.  Martinez heard (right photo, left to right), Harry E. Lewis and Shedrick Fields, both respected Pittsburgh citizens, tell Alderman Fitzgerald how they were denied service on Sept. 16 in the East Pittsburgh tavern, owned by Martinez. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Harry E. Lewis, Shedrick Fields, and John Martinez facing Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald during discrimination hearing
